cleaned_text: What if the person has an allergy or is allergic to latex? Comirnaty is latex-free. The vial stopper is made with synthetic rubber (bromobutyl), not natural rubber latex. The only contraindication for Comirnaty is a history of anaphylaxis to a previous dose of this vaccine or its contents. Find more information on [severe allergic reactions after immunisation here](https://covid.immune.org.nz/responses-after-vaccination), and the [contents of Comirnaty here.](https://covid.immune.org.nz/how-comirnaty-made-and-what-it-contains) Those with a history of immediate allergic response to another product or vaccine can receive this vaccine but are asked to wait to be observed for a little longer after vaccination. Individuals who have anaphylaxis following a previous dose of Comirnaty can be offered an other COVID-19 vaccine (currently, Nuvaxovid COVID-19 vaccine) if not contraindicated.
